metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29912 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Requests initiated through reader mode did not properly omit cookies with a SameSite attribute. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.9, Firefox ESR < 91.9, and Firefox < 100.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29912` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
